definition: civil police/PRC police/abbr. for 人民警察
traffic police/abbr. for 交通警察
to sound an alarm/to report sth to the police
to be on the alert/vigilant/alert/on guard/to warn
abbr. for 刑事警察[xing2 shi4 jing3 cha2]/criminal police

sentences.english: She cleverly got rid of the rogues who followed her, and called the police.
sentences.chinese: 甩脱了尾随她的小流氓，然后报了警。

sentences.english: Led by ray sheriff launched large-scale relationship with 100 chase.
sentences.chinese: 以雷警长率领的警平易近近百人展开了大规模追捕。

sentences.english: Nowadays its keystone is to treat the police with true feelings.
sentences.chinese: 现阶段从优待警的侧重点是以情待警。

sentences.english: The Mayor sent a man to the Thiviers station and alerted the police.
sentences.chinese: 市长派人去特维埃车站，向警察局报了警。

sentences.english: Then he reached for his phone to call the police.
sentences.chinese: 接着，他拿起他的手机报了警。

sentences.english: Genscher nearly bled to death but managed to call police.
sentences.chinese: 詹斯特差点儿因失血过多死亡，还好他挣扎着报了警。

sentences.english: The roommate called the police, who found the young woman and took her to the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 她的室友发现了这个女人，把她送到了医院并报了警。

sentences.english: The thief ran like anything when he heared the alarm.
sentences.chinese: 那贼听到警铃声飞快地逃走了。

sentences.english: Up jumped the troopers, one, two, three.
sentences.chinese: 巡逻警突然跳出来，一，二，三个。

sentences.english: Somebody called the police on my dogs one time.
sentences.chinese: 有次有人因为我的狗而报了警。

sentences.english: When did the watchman call the police?
sentences.chinese: 看守人在什么时候报的警？

sentences.english: Soon after I found out I had Aids. Two weeks later, I told the police.
sentences.chinese: 在检查出艾滋病两周后，我报了警。

sentences.english: She would not say who called police but said others were in the house.
sentences.chinese: 她不愿说出谁报的警但提及当时家中还有其他人。

sentences.english: Any is not too much to clear, but take the time to report to the police.
sentences.chinese: 沈凡并没有过多地去辨白，而是抓紧时间去报了警。

sentences.english: The morning sky is red, sea police fisherman.
sentences.chinese: 早晨天发红，海上警渔翁。

definition: to sound an alarm/to report sth to the police
civil police/PRC police/abbr. for 人民警察
to dispatch police to the scene of crime, accident etc
to report a case to the authorities
public security bureau (government office similar in function to a police station)
traffic police/abbr. for 交通警察
(of police, fire brigade etc) to receive a report of an incident
SWAT (Special Weapons And Tactics)/riot police/abbr. for 特種警察|特种警察[te4 zhong3 jing3 cha2]
